question.title: Swap the objects
question.content:
Classes and objects are one of the most important part of C++.
Here we will learn to use classes and objects and we'll swap the values of two objects. We'll provide name, number, and height for two objects.

Example:

Input: Morty 1234 6
\t Rick 5678 5
Output: Morty 1234 6 
\t  Rick 5678 5 
\t  Rick 5678 5 
\t  Morty 1234 6

Explanation: First we print the original values of obj1 and obj2 in two lines. The next two lines contain swapped values of obj1 and obj2.

Constraints:
1<= |name| <= 100
1 <= number <= 99999
1 <= height <= 10

rephrased.body: Create a C++ program that utilizes classes and objects to store and swap data. Define a class that holds the name, number, and height of an object. The program should take input for two objects and then swap their values. Print the original values of both objects, followed by the swapped values.

testcases.explanation: The program first outputs the original values of the two objects (Morty and Rick). Then, it swaps the values and outputs the swapped values in the subsequent two lines.

hints: 1. Use basic concept of swapping with class object.
